title: 75/4. Special session of the General Assembly in response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic

paragraphs.1: Decides that the special session of the General Assembly in response to the COVID-19 pandemic at the level of Heads of State and Government will be held for two days, on 3 and 4 December 2020, from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. at United Nations Headquarters in New York;
paragraphs.2: Also decides that the proceedings of the special session shall be governed by the rules of procedure of the General Assembly;
paragraphs.3: Further decides that the organizational arrangements for the special session shall be as follows: (a) The special session shall consist of: (i) An opening segment; (ii) A general debate; (iii) A presentation by and an interactive dialogue led by the Head of the World Health Organization and other relevant United Nations entities1 and, if time permits, with relevant stakeholders, on their inter-agency coordination efforts to address the COVID-19 pandemic and its impacts; (iv) A closing segment; (b) The opening of the special session shall include statements by the President of the General Assembly, the Secretary-General, including in his role as Chair of the United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination, the President of the Economic and Social Council, the President of the Security Council and the Chair of the Movement of Non-Aligned Countries; (c) The general debate shall take place on the first day of the special session and shall include statements by Member and Observer States, the European Union, and, time permitting, a limited number of representatives from relevant organizations attending the special session, in line with subparagraphs (d) and (e) below, selected by the President of the General Assembly, in consultation with Member States, with due regard for geographical balance and gender equity; the list of speakers shall be established in accordance with the established practices of the Assembly, and the time limit for the statements will be five minutes for individual delegations and seven minutes for statements made on behalf of a group of States; (d) Representatives of non-governmental organizations in consultative status with the Economic and Social Council are invited to participate in the special session in accordance with the rules of procedure and established practice of the General Assembly; (e) Recalling the established practice of the General Assembly, the President of the General Assembly shall draw up a list of other relevant representatives of non-governmental organizations, civil society organizations, academic institutions and the private sector who may participate in the special session, taking into account the principles of transparency and equitable geographical representation, with due regard for the meaningful participation of women, and submit the list to Member States for their consideration on a non-objection basis;2
paragraphs.4: Decides, without setting a precedent for future special sessions, that, in connection with the limitations recommended for meetings held on United Nations premises as precautionary measures aimed at containing the spread of COVID-19: (a) Without setting a precedent for future special sessions of the General Assembly, each Member State, Observer State, and the European Union, as well as representatives from relevant organizations attending the special session, in line with subparagraphs (a), (d) and (e) of paragraph 3 above, can submit a pre-recorded statement by their Head of State or Government, head of delegation or other dignitary, which will be played in the General Assembly Hall during the opening and general debate of the special session, after introduction by their representative who is physically present in the Assembly Hall; (b) In addition to the verbatim records of the special session, the President of the General Assembly will circulate as a document of the Assembly a compilation document of the statements delivered by Heads of State and Government or other dignitaries by means of pre-recorded statements during the special session and submitted to the President no later than the day on which the pre-recorded statement is played in the Assembly Hall; (c) These procedures shall apply only to the meetings of the special session of the General Assembly in response to the COVID-19 pandemic;
paragraphs.5: Also decides that the proceedings of the special session shall be webcast, and encourages the President of the General Assembly and the Secretary-General to give the highest visibility to the special session, through all relevant media platforms and information and communications technologies;
paragraphs.6: Requests the Secretary-General to include in his statement, as appropriate, information about the implementation of the relevant General Assembly resolutions on the COVID-19 pandemic, including but not limited to, access to vaccines and medical equipment to face the COVID-19 pandemic;
paragraphs.7: Invites all relevant United Nations system entities, including United Nations funds, programmes, and specialized agencies and regional commissions, as well as relevant intergovernmental, regional and subregional organizations, to participate in the special session;
paragraphs.8: Requests the President of the General Assembly to prepare an informal factual summary to reflect information presented during the special session;
paragraphs.9: Also requests the President of the General Assembly, in consultation with Member States, to finalize the other organizational arrangements for the special session;
paragraphs.10: Decides that the special session shall be conducted within existing resources.
